channel.title: Full Code For Ipban

Pleaz Post It Here!

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

In linux, type: ‘iptables -A INPUT -s ipgoeshere -j DROP’

In windows, install a firewall and ban the specific IP however you have to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Full Code For Ipban
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“Ewa Hax, post:1, topic:126903”][quote]
if(command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“YourName”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
if(otherPIndex != -1 && server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex] != null) {
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
appendToBannedIP(p.connectedFrom);
}
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is IPbanning "+victim);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully IPbanned”);
}[/quote]

Just change your name into your character name so no-one can ip ban you :D[/quote]
Can you tell me what that post is then?

Read full topic

item.title: Full Code For Ipban
item.dc:creator: @ShadowShaft ShadowShaft
item.description:
@ShadowShaft wrote:

Let me make it clear…

[b]CODE a command[/b] that [b]adds[/b] a IP to a [b]textfile[/b]. Let the textfile be [b]loaded everytime server restarts[/b].

Read full topic

item.title: Full Code For Ipban
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“ShadowShaft, post:10, topic:126888”][quote author=The Rtard link=topic=177510.msg1626913#msg1626913 date=1185351275]
wtf u doing posting here why dont you go back to your geek convention and talk to your friends?

Anyone else that can help?
[/quote]
Dang your a noob!

CODE a command that adds a IP to a textfile. Let the textfile be loaded everytime server restarts.

In server.java

if("IP" && ipbanned == true) { returncode = 4; //thats banned idk wich for ip banned } else { //connection shit }

Fag.[/quote]

Why would you want to edit your files everytime you wanted to ban someone? A command is easier imo.

Read full topic
